feed.title: Combined summary - Re: PAPER: New algorithm for the discrete logarithm problem on elliptic curves

entry.title: Combined summary - Re: PAPER: New algorithm for the discrete logarithm problem on elliptic curves
entry.summary: On April 7, 2015, Gregory Maxwell sent an email in which he apologized for a false alarm and spamming. The email contained two links, one directing to a PDF file on eprint.iacr.org, and the other link leading to a Reddit thread discussing a new algorithm for the discrete logarithm problem. The first link points to a PDF file available on eprint.iacr.org, which is a website that hosts cryptographic research papers. The content of the PDF file is not specified in the context, but it is most likely related to cryptography, given the nature of the website. The second link takes us to a Reddit thread where a new algorithm for solving the discrete logarithm problem is being discussed. The discrete logarithm problem is a fundamental problem in cryptography and number theory. It involves finding a solution to an equation of the form g^x mod p = y, where g, p, and y are known values, and x is the unknown value that needs to be solved. In conclusion, Gregory Maxwell's email contained two links, one leading to a PDF file on eprint.iacr.org, and the other leading to a Reddit thread discussing a new algorithm for the discrete logarithm problem. The content of the PDF file is unknown, but it is most likely related to cryptography. The discrete logarithm problem is a fundamental problem in cryptography and number theory, and the algorithm being discussed in the Reddit thread could have significant implications for the field.
